title: How to Locate the Model Number on a Dryer

steps.title: The model number sticker is right inside your dryer's door.
steps.content: The model number sticker is right inside your dryer's door. Open your Whirlpool dryer door and locate the sticker on the top-left corner of the dryer's inner rim. You'll find both the model and serial numbers printed on this sticker. [1] X Research source

steps.title: You'll find your Kenmore dryer's model number inside the door.
steps.content: You'll find your Kenmore dryer's model number inside the door. Open the door, and check the top and bottom of the door's inner side. You'll find both the model and serial number on the sticker.

steps.title: Your Maytag dryer's model number can be found in one of four locations.
steps.content: Your Maytag dryer's model number can be found in one of four locations. The location of the model and serial number plate varies by model, but you'll always find it in one of these four spots: On the upper-left corner of the back of your dryer. On the inside of your dryer at the back of the top, visible only when the door is open. On the inner wall or rim of the door. If you have a gas dryer , you may find the model number behind the access panel. [2] X Research source

steps.title: You can find your Samsung dryer's model number in one of two places.
steps.content: You can find your Samsung dryer's model number in one of two places. On most Samsung dryers , you just need to open the dryer door and look for a sticker on the door's inner rim. On some models, you may find the model and serial number sticker on the back of the dryer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Your Bosch dryer's model number is inside the door.
steps.content: Your Bosch dryer's model number is inside the door. Open the door and locate the sticker on the top of the door's inside rim, just above the glass. The model and serial numbers can both be found on this sticker. [4] X Research source

steps.title: You'll find the model number inside your dryer door.
steps.content: You'll find the model number inside your dryer door. Open your Frigidaire dryer's door and inspect the door's inner rim. If you don't see a sticker on the door itself, it'll be on the inside rim of your dryer.

steps.title: The location of your Miele dryer's model number varies by model.
steps.content: The location of your Miele dryer's model number varies by model. To locate the model and serial numbers of your Miele dryer: Tumble dryer: Open the door and locate the plate at the bottom of the front plate of the dryer. Washer-dryer combo: Open the door and find the plate affixed to the door's inner rim.

steps.title: Your dryer's model number is usually just inside the door.
steps.content: Your dryer's model number is usually just inside the door. Open your Speed Queen dryer's door and look for a sticker on the front plate/rim near the door latch. You'll find the model and serial numbers printed on this sticker on both residential and commercial Speed Queen dryers.

steps.title: The model number sticker is visible when the dryer door is open.
steps.content: The model number sticker is visible when the dryer door is open. Open your GE dryer's door, then find the sticker inside the front face of the dryer on the left or right side. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Your LG dryer's model number is inside the dryer.
steps.content: Your LG dryer's model number is inside the dryer. The sticker is only visible when the dryer door is open. Just open the door and locate the sticker at the top-right corner of its front panel. [6] X Research source

steps.title: The model and serial number location varies depending on dryer type.
steps.content: The model and serial number location varies depending on dryer type. Front loading dryers: Open the dryer door. If your dryer was manufactured after 2001, you'll find the model number plate inside the door at the top. If you don't see the sticker, check the back of the dryer. For older dryers, the model number is on the sticker you see on the front of the dryer when the door is open. Top loading dryers: You'll find the model and serial numbers on the back of the dryer's control panel. It'll be on the left side of the back panel when you're facing the appliance.
